alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 12:55PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... ...MARINERS ON LAKE MOULTRIE AND EASTERN LAKE MARION SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 1255 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Northern Lake Moultrie to Naval Weapons Station Charleston to Folly Beach, and moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Moncks Corner, McClellanville, Fort Sumter, and Downtown Charleston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie and the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
